cards.q: What are some of the needs of people
cards.a:
- income
- freedom
- respect
- security
- equal treatment

cards.q: What is **Per Capita Income**
cards.a: Total Income of a country divided by Total Population

cards.q: Who brings out World Development Reports
What are some of the needs of people
cards.a:
- income
- freedom
- respect
- security
- equal treatment

cards.q: What is **Per Capita Income**
cards.a: Total Income of a country divided by Total Population

cards.q: Who brings out World Development Reports
What is the criteria for high income countries as per World Bank
cards.a: Countries with per capita income of USD 49,300 per annum in 2019

cards.q: What was India's per capita income in 2019
What is Infant Mortality Rate or IMR
cards.a: Number of children that die before the age of one year as a proportion of 1000 live children born in that particular year

cards.q: What is Literacy Rate
cards.a: Proportion of Literate population in the 7-and-above age group

cards.q: What is Net Attendance Ratio
cards.a: Total number of children of age group 14 and 15 years attending school as a percentage of total number of children in the same age group

cards.q: What are some of the things that *money cannot buy*
cards.a:
- pollution-free environment
- infection-free environment
- unadulterated medicines

cards.q: What is full form of PDS
What is full form of UNDP
What criteria does the Human Development Report by UNDP take for its analysis
cards.a:
1. Education level
2. Health status
3. Per Capita Income

cards.q: What is full form of HDI
What is Life Expectancy at Birth
cards.a: It is the average expected length of life of a person at the time of birth

cards.q: What is India's HDI rank in 2019
Why is Per Capita Income calculated in US Dollars only
cards.a: So that it can be compared

cards.q: How is Per Capita Income adjusted for a country
cards.a: Done in a way that a dollar would buy the same amount of goods and services in any country
